reviewText:
A true sandbox experience, with nothing to stop the player from creating whatever they choose. It can be sometimes annoying to learn the ins and outs if you are playing solo or with a few newbie friends since you cannot just ask your question into chat, so be prepared for possible growing pains early in the learning curve. The Steam forums will provide the answers you need if you become confused about how to proceed or what to do. If you enjoy building / crafting games in general, this is likely to be a good title for you. It seems well-optimized and does not require a top of the line computer to max out the graphics settings, allowing you to play in a visually satisfying world.

The game ships with 2 separate modes, creative and adventure. Creative is a blank canvas of a world, and Adventure has a storyline with Kingdoms and NPCs established around you. You can create your own server and password protect it so that only your invited friends can play with you, or you can join another player's server if you prefer. You have full control over the settings that determine the percentage of aggresive creatures in your world, or the timer for how long your crops take to mature, as well as GM abilities to modify or create objects.

Unlike the online version with its monthly fee, it is a good title for those who have demanding schedules or varied interests, since you own the product and can return to it at will. It is said that the further development of the game will follow the development of the online version, so that updates and patches will become available.

Building / crafting games are, by their very definition, a lot of work to make all the creations that you want. If you understand that at the start, then this is a rewarding title with much satisfaction to be gained from it.
voteText: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Probably the deepest and most complete world-building/crafting/survival game out there.

First, and most important recommendation; Play Wurm Online (different game) first. It's free to play and you can use it as a demo, as it is the exact same game as Wurm Unlimited.

Totally configurable, but please stick with either the defaults or with minimal enhancements. WU defaults are already hugely faster than the original online version.

Keep the survival aspect of this crafting world-builder. Enjoy the journey, not the end. You have an entire world, unlimited characters to put in it, built in LAN support (Manage Server) or can download the Steam Wurm Dedicated Server from the Tools tab and invite the whole world of Steam players to play, build and craft in your world...or join their servers.

It can be as casual or hardcare as you like it. The crafting and terraforming are complex and multi-layered. Aggressive creatures are unforgiving, and the world is huge. Stick with it, enjoy the journey, and you too will see the true charm of this game.

reviewText:
Overall Rating: 8/10 Fajitas

Wurm Unlimited is a descendant of Wurm Online, a game created by Code Club AB, and the original hearth to Minecraft. (Notch was apart of this team at one point)  This game, for its age, seems superior to other games that try to mimic or hold the ideals that WO(WU) has.

PROS:
Excessive amounts of freedom
Incredibly manipulative for a game so old
Runs easily
Game is good for hobbying instead of full on no-lifing.
Has a medieval sense of style, if you like that, you might like this.
Lots of things to build and make.

CONS:
Can be slow depending on your game mode.
Action Timers, Action Timers everywhere!
Lots of Formulas.
Lackluster fighting
Administrative commands can be iffy.
GUI is clunky. Based heavily on boxes all over the screen.
Gameplay early on is horrendous.
Private Servers that go up and down constantly make time-related actions (Breeding, Farming) harder to do.

... Now why?

Wurm has always had a soft spot in my heart, since i'm largely a hobbyist, this is one of those good games. You sit down for a bit, watch some Netflix, and chill; For a new player though, they might come across this game expecting to quickly jump into everything. The learning curve is large, and can almost kill the fun if someone is too slow to recognize what they have to do. Playing lone is nearly impossible as a newbie, but the point of WU is to still have your 'family', or a village to make or join. Where the community comes into play, the game gets better.

Communities usually keep the game interesting, someone to talk to along with some drama can certainly lighten up your day. Doing the missions, running around fighting unique monsters, and screaming and yelling as you murder other players are all somewhat community based activites that can be fun, or just straight up challenging.

This game is a standout from today's releases. Only one other game has tried its hand so well into WU's style, and considering it was made to try and outdo it. WU holds its own. The graphics might be bad, the gameplay might be a bit clunky at times, but it can keep you interested for hours if you find the littlest hint of something you might like. Watching those numbers go up? Makes you feel like a king once you get high up there.

reviewText:
i have to say love this game an have had a amazing time in this game
the server i play on is razor-edge other know as ages of urath
this server has really made my experience  worth its wild with it mods an awesome GMs/community
they have a web site teamspeak an alot of mods to enjoy from here is there web site..http://razors-edge.enjin.com/
come join the amazing server an great experience

Long time WO players. Very newbie friendly and helpful.
-Newbie City
-Huge 4096 Maps
- 5x exp 3x Action Timers.
- Running Ago modloader.
- Support for Ago Client modloader
- No crop decay
- Horse Names
- Random Boss encounters (event timers)
- Live Map: http://razors-edge.ddns.net/

-Dev team and support staff for issues (see below)
-Dedicated private hosted server (see below)
-[Open] Razors Edge 24/7 Custom Maps! [Listed] (as displayed in server listing)
-Dedicated TS
- Multi Map with PVP zones
- Realtime map with Google Earth
-Player projects with rewards. Starting city is player made.
-No GM abuse
Visit our page at: www.razors-edge.org for forums, TS info, event schedule, and maps.
Our staff is a group of dedicated fun bunch, including a system administrator, program developer, graphic and animation designer, SQL DBA.
Server is running on a 32 core, 64Gb memory, SSD RAID 1. With 100Mb up / down stream of bandwidth.

reviewText:
One of the most tedious games I have ever played. You can spend hours left clicking a button to make 60 planks only for more than half to fail. I would recommend to join a server with a x3 or higher skill gain.

Still, when you DO make those 60 planks, or rather IF you make those 60 planks, it's pretty satisfying.

Indeed, playing Wurm gives you the same satisfaction as doing menial tasks in the real world. It is easy to spend hours digging dirt or cutting trees, and I'm stull unsure if this is a good thing.

reviewText: My first ever review.........This is not a game for those who are easily bored, if you need gunfire and screams it's not for you.  If you like to work your way from nothing building up a multitude of skills then crack on with it, the satisfaction alone will have you hooked.  Graphics are quite breathtaking, it can be played as a stand alone and you are King of all you survey or you can join one of the many dedicated servers and join other like minded building enthusiasts in creating a Utopian society, I would advise the latter as even a self confessed addict like me enjoys the break from the boredom that comes with the community chat.  I will not go on about the game play since it isn't really rocket science, mine, dig, build create, upgrade and sell or buy.  Joining a server gives you the option to concentrate on a particular set of skills and barter with other players or as I do just get on and do it yourself.  Many times I have thought  That's it I have had enough!!!!" but each time I am drawn back in with the old "Well I could just finish that ship routine"  Is it worth the time and effort?  Maybe not but I still play anyway
date: if you have a life this game probably wont suit you but there again who knows
recommended: In short try it and see."
voteText: true
votesHelpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: After playing Wurm Online for 12+ years I can say I fully support the stand alone version. You get all the same features and experience for the cost of a 1 month sub. No other game gives you the ability to truly manipulate the world to your liking. From mapless roads, to intricate cave systems, creating your own mountains or valleys. Wurm is your true sandbox experience.
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is so wondrous!! It's Wurm online without the fees!
I loved Wurm online but i'm more of a causal player so i couldnt justify the constant money drain.
Now, the game has a steep learning curve and you need to learn it to enjoy the game, the graphics arnt the best but after awhile you will see the beauty in the graphics.. its odd you start to think this is so amazing looking. I think its your Imagination, that takes hold as you need to plan your life, your house, your land as you can plan every aspect in this game.

New players NEED to read and follow the newbi guides wiki, otherwise you will probably give up.

Saying all that, the only thing I dont like at the moment is that your at the mercy of the server host.. you start on a server that looks to be stable, has a domain with forums etc, spend a few hours digging.. you come back the next day and the server is gone.

This game will take over my already far too busy life.. Im so happy about this game :)
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I have played and loved Wurm Online for over three years, but always wished I could have more freedom to do what I want in the game. I always felt my creativity was limited by the need to gather resources and put more time into making it real than I could give.

Wurm Unlimited has changed that for me, and yet still offers so much more. Not only can I use a GM-level character to build anything I desire, but I can run a server and share it with my friends. The community has already created some wonderful tools that allow you to make custom maps, and the modding community is just getting started.

The game is rather easy to launch and manage for most people. Each server" is in it's own folder
date: so I can easily make copies
recommended: zip up the good ones and store them for later
hoursPlayed: or switch between if I goof up too badly. There's a Linux-based dedicated server for cheap
voteText: cost-effective hosting.  (Server going on a $20/mo Linux VPS)\n\nThat doesn't even touch the Adventure mode
helpfulPercent: which allows a player who has never played Wurm get a real feel for some of the aspects that even MMO players never really experience. You get to work on ascending to godhood
votesHelpful: to gain powerful sorcery items
votesTotal: or do what ever! Totally up to you. It's what I'd like to call "rails-optional"\n\nI know some folks have had a hard time running the game
votesFunny: but those issues seem to be more related to hardware and software set up than anything else. Windows 10 64-bit
column16: nVidia GTX 960
column17: 16GB of RAM running on my old Athlon FX chip and the game and server both run flawlessly. (I even play Wurm Online AND Wurm Unlimited at the same time usually.)\n\nIf there's any downside I can think of
column18: it's that this isn't the type of game for everyone
column19: though Wurm Unlimited does allow you to tailor it more to your play style. There's a learning curve
column20: but sites like http://www.wurmpedia.com are there to help get past that.\n\nAll in all
column21: I'd buy it again (right after I re-up the subscriptions on my four accounts on Wurm Online)"
column25: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Wurm Unlimited has unleashed my inner crafter through a deep system of tools to sculpt the land, build your dream home (eventually), and create a well rounded character to survive in the wilderness.

Incidentally WU has become my go-to game to help me catch up on TV shows, current events, and facebook.

Dual Monitors are recommended to increase skill gains through reducing the time being distracted by Netflix.

10/10 would farm again.  And again.  I need better tools.
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
This game is the best Sanbox there is atm, you are free to do almost everything in this game better to play with group, even better to play  versus peaple and the best to play group versus group.

Did you know you can actualy become god in this game for other players to worship?
Did you know you can be king?
Did you know you can be mage?
Did you know you can be sage?
Did you know this game is more than 10yrs old and its still the only sandbox there is?

It has downsides, graphic, UI is old, character is very static and indeed perhaps the greatest problem is java.

The game itself if hard and requires some learning, but you can totaly make it mellow by reducing timers, pumping up the skill gain multiplier and setting starting stats to 30+. It is entorely up to every single player what experience he likes (I like to suffer so I play on VWT wurm alike server http://www.vwtfoundation.co.uk/Wurm/). This game highly encourages to play with other people and it makes you experience far more enjoyable. If you invest money it will reward you with hundreds hours of fun.

Try it, join the server, build community, enjoy!

reviewText: This game is different, but in such an amazing way! Yes, there are some issues, and a decent learning curve, but it's very worth it. I'm currently hosting a server for me and a couple of other friends, and we are all addicted. It's very easy to choose to live peacefully in the middle of nowhere or to go exploring for new lands and treasure. At first, I was very put off by the control scheme, but a little Google-fu" helped to fix any issues I had. Currently
date: I have 37 hours in the game
recommended: and that was all in a four day span. Another bonus for me
hoursPlayed: as the father of three kids
voteText: is that I can walk away from the game at almost any point and not have to worry about what happens while I'm dealing with real life. There is enough content here already to keep me busy for a very long time
helpfulPercent: but I'm also looking forward to any mods that may come our way!"

reviewText: My first ever review.........This is not a game for those who are easily bored, if you need gunfire and screams it's not for you.  If you like to work your way from nothing building up a multitude of skills then crack on with it, the satisfaction alone will have you hooked.  Graphics are quite breathtaking, it can be played as a stand alone and you are King of all you survey or you can join one of the many dedicated servers and join other like minded building enthusiasts in creating a Utopian society, I would advise the latter as even a self confessed addict like me enjoys the break from the boredom that comes with the community chat.  I will not go on about the game play since it isn't really rocket science, mine, dig, build create, upgrade and sell or buy.  Joining a server gives you the option to concentrate on a particular set of skills and barter with other players or as I do just get on and do it yourself.  Many times I have thought  That's it I have had enough!!!!" but each time I am drawn back in with the old "Well I could just finish that ship routine"  Is it worth the time and effort?  Maybe not but I still play anyway
date: if you have a life this game probably wont suit you but there again who knows
recommended: In short try it and see."

reviewText:
One of the most tedious games I have ever played. You can spend hours left clicking a button to make 60 planks only for more than half to fail. I would recommend to join a server with a x3 or higher skill gain.

Still, when you DO make those 60 planks, or rather IF you make those 60 planks, it's pretty satisfying.

Indeed, playing Wurm gives you the same satisfaction as doing menial tasks in the real world. It is easy to spend hours digging dirt or cutting trees, and I'm stull unsure if this is a good thing.

reviewText: This is my first negative review, and I also believe that a review, good or bad, should be justified and explained so I'm going do that instead of writing a 2-sentence review that any 6-year old can do to try to maliciously hurt a product/company that is in reality pretty good simply because someone offended their entitlements to being provided slave service and never-ending convenience was slighted by someone, wither or not the company had anything to do with it or not...\n\nWurm in itself is as sandbox as sandbox gets. There's no shortage of things a player could do from the moment they first log in. It is, however, a very niche genre too and requires a type of gamer with an acquired taste for this sort of thing to actually enjoy playing it. I would say the biggest downside to the Wurm experience is the notoriously clunky design of the game (UI, movement, the mechanics of the game in general, even the way it looks and feels). Some would say the graphics also suck too, and rightly so (can you say 1990s?) -- but that isn't really what makes a good game a good game" either
date: so I wouldn't even count that against it personally.\n\nIf you are looking for a game that is fast paced and built more for the twitch gamer then do NOT buy this -- you are GARUNTEED to hate this if you do
recommended: you have been warned! On the other hand -- if you are the kind of gamer who likes to take their time and plan things out into what you are doing in the game
voteText: this may be a good game for you.\n\nA lot of people would herald Wurm as being the king of grinding games -- though this is may not be necessarily true for Unlimited as you can adjust the skill-curve as you want if you are the one hosting the server you play on
helpfulPercent:
or you choose to play on a server that has a more forgiving skill-curve.

I have played Wurm Online (Unlimited's predecessor) before and this is where all of my observations above stem from. I had gotten Unlimited for two reasons: 1) Because some old friends were playing it a lot and I thought I could give it a shot 2) The biggest reason -- so I could get some work in learning how to develop code in Java by making mods for Wurm.

I regret it deeply.

This game really should be posted as early access at best. As a provider for a Server (or at least I tried) the process that you have to go through in order to get a server setup in the first place was a absolute nightmare. I literally had to dump the last two days straight almost into trying to get the server running the way I wanted (multiple maps

reviewText:
I was suckered into buying this game by the large number of positive reviews. I really wanted to like it - I love sandbox games, and this seemed to tick every box for me, but it has some huge problems that most of the reviews I read either didn't mention or glossed over.

Firstly, the UI is appalling. I found it unintuitive and unnecessarily labyrinthine. This is not a game you can load up and figure out how to play as you go along. You need to go to the wiki for even the most basic things, and the UI is so vastly different to most other games within the same genre you need to be prepared to learn a whole new way of controlling your charater and playing a game - a way dreamed up by a committee of insanely pedantic sadists - at least that's what it feels like.

Secondly, progress is laughably slow on default settings. Your starting character is so incapable it might as well be a toddler, and being able to perform even basic actions reliably well seems to require hours of grinding.

Thirdly, while the game is clearly feature-rich this can also make it overwhelming for a new player, since the game makes no attempt at breaking you into the world slowly and carefully in an enjoyable way.

Do not buy unless you are willing to do the following.

1) Devote hours of time to reading the wiki.
2) Print the wiki, or have it on another screen so you can make proper use of it.
3) Spend hours on boring, repetitive tasks (dig some dirt, drop it, dig some more dirt, drop it, repeat for OVER AN HOUR to get digging skill to a useful level).
4) Treat this game like a second job, and spend several hours on it every day, performing mostly boring, repetitive tasks, in order to one day, in several months time, be able to build a semi-decent house somewhere.

If that hasn't convinced you to pass on this, then consider my first half-hour of play.

Minutes 1-10: Face sculpt my character, full of excitement for this new game I'm clearly going to spend hours and hours enjoying.
Minutes 10-20: Explore the labyrinthine UI, trying to work out how the hell to do anything. Seriously, would a bit of context-sensitive left-clicking kill you people??
Minutes 20-25: Give up trying to understand the UI. Venture outside the starting town. Find a sheep. Click Look after" the sheep. Try and puzzle out what has changed. Click "look after" a small dog. Get told I can only "look after" one animal at a time. Punch the dog.
Minutes 25-30: Trade blows with the dog. For five minutes. Neither of us loses more than one third of our health in that time. Log out and go and read the wiki.

After an hour of exploring the wiki
date: I'm convinced this game is not for me."

reviewText:
I don't usually review but here we go?

This game is hard, and it will be hard for a while until you train up skills.

A good compare would be WoW meets Eve Online and has a baby, and the baby takes more after the Mother (Eve).

You don't need to read the reviews to try the game, Go try Wurm Online it is almost exactly the same. Like WoW you can play all you want but your skills won't go past 20 without paying a monthly fee.

I have played wurm online so I am already familar with the GUI and systems.

The GUI if you have ever played eve online you will understand, its not for everyone, and you can tweak controls to bind to different keys making things a bit easier.

You will want people to play with no matter the style you play (most of you).

A boar may kill you while you are building parts to make a wagon. Fact (tried to fight, did not go well).

(Adventure)
You will die.
You will grind to make stuff.
You will will grind to get stuff.
{As you level your skills it will be less of a grind}
(Action speeds are adjustable in the server)
The time you put in will make things worth more to you then just getting it.

I have played Wow, Eve, and both Wurm Versions. I like all of them and would suggest any of them.
Is this game for everyone no. If you don't put in to make your builds yours then you wont get anything in return.
I have had no trouble setting up my server and getting it running (if you would like to join {-TGD-}Gaming msg me)
There are some bugs most new releases have them, quite a lot had to be changed to make it work like this from Wurm Online.

If in doubt try Wurm Online. You will never know if its for you if you don't. Find some friends and create a world.
Oh and I haven't tried yet but being able to setup multiple severs linked in a cluster is badass if i can find enough people to justify trying it out.

I hope this helps some people. Thanks for reading.
voteText: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Not for the faint of heart.
This is the most in-depth Sandbox MMO I have ever seen.Everything is player made and it is up to you to build or die. The world is relentless and has a difficulty reminscient of ArmA 3. You can't just run around and kill everything from the start. This game requires commitment and endurance. Be prepared to lose everything from a monster hiding just around the corner or a fall you knew wasn't going to end well. Be prepared for moments satisfaction when you marvel at your creations.
This the EvE of Minecraft(that came before Minecraft and was initially co-developed by Notch) with so much more content.
If you want instant gratification and eye candy, then look elsewhere(Maybe FFXIV online). This game focuses on depth rather than looks.
You will never experience it all but that won't stop you from trying.

reviewText: This is one review that's going to be difficult for me to list anything negative about this game becuase i love it. So with that said i will attempt to add in what i think other people might say or think about it and throw in my own opinions. This is a game where your only limited by your imagination and time and effort into. What you put into it is exactly what you will get out of it. I for one love the graphics in the game, some people may not but that can go with everything else in life to me becuase were not all alike. There is a lot to learn as you go but there are a lot of good people to counter the idiots of the world who are more than willing to help you along the way if it's needed but seriously if you can read and have half a brain i would'nt  call any of it overwhelming.  This is the crafting game for the true crafter that has the time to really spend to get into it and if you want the survival part as well , dont worry there is enough things around that label you as lunch. The fighting isnt action packed and somewhat simple but adds just enough fun for me. I recommend this game to the more mature player.

reviewText:

If you want a true sandbox game this is it. If you want a none Quest pounding game  this is it. If you want a world where you can change the landscape by raising a land from water to mining down a mountain to the ocean floor this is it.

A world filled with creatures and land to explore. A Game where textures are 512 and up so no more plain block looking texttures. A sort of mine craft feel with out the minecraft this is the game.

Ability to mod and add new textures, models, etc... this is the game. Ability to host your own server an make your own rules this is the game.

My personal Opinion This is the game SWG, EQ fans have been waiting for and with mods it can only get better.

reviewText:
After 6 frustrating hours of trying to set up a server, the only way being to open ports directly in your ROUTER(!) it finally runs-definetly not a state of the art game, but it looks ok. Nevermind a couple of bugs-at least i dindt have any gamebreakers i heard about here and there.

I really saw big potential in this game-5 years ago.
This is the last try of keeping it alive, as the online version is running out of subscribers. And who can blame them. with a skill gain that takes you longer to learn sth. than in real life!

STILL:
+Unprecedented Crafting (from the smallest thread and nail to giant statues)
+Total freedom
+Well moddable
+very peaceful gaming

-The server set-up is a GIANT throwback to the 90´s(runs fine once you set it up btw)
-Total Freedom:the world seems a bit TOO empty at times, but its designed as aMMO, so that´s forgivable
-A really bad terrain manipulation system( its not blocks on top of each other, but rather like...pillars of different height next to each other) you want to tunnel under your tunnel? Bad luck...a Pillar can have only One hole(!)(?)...Straaaaaange system.
-VERY buggy at the moment-strange, youd´think a 10yearold game would have most things ironed out.
-keep a tab of the crafting  wiki handy...you´ll spen at least 10-20& of the game there

IF you can look beyond this-i can recommend it...barely...
I´d say wait for a sale, dont ♥♥♥♥♥ around like i did, go with it.

reviewText:
This game is awesome. It's got a pretty steep learning curve. I'll go into that in a moment. Many players have started out with watching Youtube videos and reading walkthroughs before they start. Also the MAP (M) doesn't show your location. Those are the downsides.

Starting out:
You'll type a character name in, most likely select a server and connect to it. Then you'll be prompted to customise your face and off you go, seemingly dropped in the deep end.

Once the initial pops are closed you'll see you main game window. Think Minecraft with way better graphics and no blocks!
Turning around (WADS) is simple enough. If you press I you'll get your inventory up. C brings up your character screen if you're curious.

To the top left you have a stamina bar (how much energy you have). Doing heavy work or pulling heavy loads will make that drop. The lower it is the slower you'll work, so it's worth letting it fill regularly. Under that you have food and water. Drinking from any clean water source fills up your water bar quite quickly. Early on your best bet for food will be pumpkins. Other higher quality sources of food will bolster your nutrition value and provide learning advantages.

Ok.. now how to begin. Hit M. If you've joined a server anything like the last one I joined you'll have had a message telling you your starting grid on the map. That's it as far as map assistance is concerned. Stand still a while and you can read your compass in the top left, and get a good idea where you're headed. You'll have to pay attention to landmarks and figure out your own position from there. For reference the server I've just started on is New Isles". There
date: you start in the grid to the SW of "Hearth" on the map. K11 I believe.\n\nSo
recommended: off you go exploring. If you happen to get attacked by any nasties for now
hoursPlayed: it's probbaly best to make a run for it. If you are near town and type "help" in the local chat window
voteText: guards from nearby towns will assist and deal with the threat.\n\nEventually you'll hopefully find a spot with some water source nearby for drinking
helpfulPercent: plenty of trees for wood
votesHelpful: and a nice big slope for mining opportunities. Other useful resources include things like Sand
votesTotal: Clay
votesFunny: Peat
column16: Moss etc.\n\nOpen your bag. To "READY" an item for use
column17: you simply double click it
column18: so double click your "Deed Stake" now. It should go green. Right click it to interact with it
column19: and create your settlement. Start small as you can always resize it with your guards helping to clear threats as you go.\n\nNow you have a base of operations. If you've chosen to join someone elses town
column20: you'll be in a similar position now on a plot. When you die now
column21: you can respawn from your town centre.\n\nLets get some food first. Moving around and right clicking grass tiles will enable you to forage (explore the menus when you right click different things). Pumpkins will pop up once in a while. Right clicking one will give you the chance to eat it - watch your food bar recover. Do remember that the right click options will change depending on what item you have READY. If you have a Spade ready for example
column22: you may be able to dig the earth too.\n\nItems all have weights. If you get overloaded
column23: it may be worth dropping bits on the floor for now or your stamina bar will take a heavy hit and slow you down to boot.\n\nLets get started on a mine first
column24: as iron plays a bit part. Face the steep slope nearby with your shovel equipped. You'll notice when moving your cursor over the floor tiles that you can see tile "borders" and centres as well as corners. As you become more experienced
column25: mousing over borders will tell you the gradient of tiles. The shallower the slope
column26: the easier it will be to pass / climb. If you stand on a corner and mouse over the borders going out from it you'll see where you could do with raising or lowering the land around you. Ideally slopes with a gradient of 15 or less make for easy passage. I tend to make mine with a 15 gradient when a path needs to go up or down.\n\nNow stand towards the middle of the slope
column27: and start digging! As you dig you'll collect dirt in your inventory (press i). Right click the dirt to drop it AS A PILE when you have a few
column29: allowing your stamina to recover between bursts of digging. Dropping dirt ON THE GROUND instead of AS A PILE will actually level that corner of the tile UP that number of (inches?) This will take a few minutes to complete. Try to level it out on the other side of the tile as you go
column30: digging further up the slope if needed so you're not left stuck in a hole you can't climb out of.\n\nEventually you'll hit rock. What you need to do now is clear off all the dirt from that tile ie each corner
column31: until what's exposed it a rock face.\n\nNow READY your pickaxe. Right click the rock face and TUNNEL into it. You now have an open mine shaft. Move into it
column32: and select the wall in front of you and MINE DOWN. This will create a slope going down. You should be at a good level now. Your best move at this stage is often to just use the "MINE" option rather than going down further - you don't want to hit the water table after all.\n\nAs you progress through the rock you can right click mine walls and prospect to look for traces of iron
column33: following their clues. When you find iron
column34: mine the iron wall and you'll get ore.\n\nThis is where it becomes more complicated. To extract the ore you'll need a furnace. Press the crafting button in the bottom right corner of your main window. In the bottom left of the crafting window is a little "list" button. Click it and type furnace in the search bar that pops up. If you click it
column35: it'll list what you need to have in your inventory to start making one. The "starting" items show what two items from your inventory need to be dragged into the boxes at the top of the crafting panel. There may be other requirements for READY tools and other items in your bag for some items. Note you may need mortar for some stone works. To make mortar
column36:
look to your crafting list again - it will show that mortar required clay and sand. Bricks on the other hand require stone shards and a chisel. In each case you'll find yourself going back to the crafting window to see if the missing component is something you can make.

Some advice - it's worth clicking on the other "chat" tabs at the bottom of the screen and speaking to other players if you're new. If there are any about when you ask they may help you to get off on the right foot / help you to spot areas of sand or clay etc. They are surface deposits and visible if you look around for them.

When you have started making your furnace back at your mine
column37: you can right click the partially assembled furnace and "add to crafting window". You'll then be able to drag one of the missing components at a time into the other box and continue building it up. In some cases you may require multiple tries until you're a more skilled craftsman.\n\nWhen it's finally finished
column38: READY your hatchet and find a nearby tree. Select the tile it's on and "CHOP" the tree until it falls. Click the felled tree and "chop" it into logs until the tree is gone. Take open on the logs form the pile (open it and right click a log -> Take).\n\nNow open your crafting panel
column39: put the log in one box and your carving knife in the other. Make some kindling. Go back to the furnace. READY your steel and flint
column40: and light the furnace (uses a kindling). Now READY the log
column41: right click the furnace and BURN the log. That should keep it going for a short time.\n\nOpen the furnace and drag any iron ore you have into it. After some time you'll be left with glowing hot iron ore
column42: which you can work with.  Take it out the furnace and put it in your inventory. You can then craft with it while hot. TIP: earth needs to be flat and a mallet eqiupped to start planning a building on your deed."

reviewText:
Really good game - I like it, but since that's not telling much allow me to go into a bit more detail:

The game is fun because indeed it is like having a personal copy of WO, which may not make much sense to some people, but the game WO is fun but sometimes I - like many others - don't want to play with the entire world on an MMORPG - so this game makes the perfect divide, it takes the MMORPG and turns it into a personal server'd game that has allowances for server passwords etc. Allowing one to *choose* who one plays with. Personally I don't like microtransactions either and this  WU alievates that problem as well, since you buy WU as a standalone product its the equivelent of having a permanent premium status without the added cost of a monthly subscription. Basically WU lives up-to it's name unlimited. It literally puts the entire game into your hands..

Edit (03/15/2016): For those unfirmiliar with WO - allow me to describe the gameplay; it basically is a minecraft-reminicent game that has elements such as crafting, building, combat (although this is not the best place for it's abilities to shine), gathering, production and use of tools. It has Monsters that you can fight against but the real beauty to me is in the creation system. You can assemble wall-by-wall a 3d decent quality house in the middle of nowhere. Due to unlimited versions capabilities you can make it where the normal WO work times are either much shorter (for easier play) or much longer (for the very tedious years of grinding to assemble one hatchet) depending on the server. Additionally the Unlimited version comes with everything you need to setup a server that is either offline (for LANs/Solo Play) or Semi-Dedicated. I call it semi-dedicated because there is no block on operating a client on the same machine as the dedicated" seerver (unlike ARK and several other games I know of) My advice: Don't buy this for the graphics or the combat
date: buy it for the amount of replayability there is in a good day's effort on the land and for the friends who may or may not accompany you. This is without a doubt a sandbox-style game."

Is you have never played WURM at all, I highly recommend you to try a public server first to be helped by other players since i can be a little bit overwhelming because it's a lot of information to take in at first. There is a lot of possibility, so a lot to learn too.

With knowledge, you'll probably try to get your own server to play with your friends, or stay on a server already implemented to establish a town with your friends.

It's a game that need you to play a long time to get used to it and comprehend it. If you are the kind of player that only play a game for less than 50 hours and never touch it again, it's not for you.

reviewText: --------Intro--------\n\nI bought a copy of Wurm Unlimited (WU) mostly out of curiosity as to what exactly is the difference between this and Wurm Online(WO). From what I've seen so far, it is essentially exactly the same game except you the servers are run by the community. The fact that you get the dedicated server" software enables you to set up your own Wurm server
date: to play locally in "singleplayer" or you after the initial set up (Port forwarding or peer-to-peer tunneling) you can play the game with your friends! The server allows you to set up "Adventure" mode
recommended: which is pretty much same as your normal WO with the option to tweak some variables such as skill gain
hoursPlayed: monster count player set up etc. Then there's "Creative" mode which I haven't tried
voteText:
but supposedly it loads up a blank map on which you can then build upon.



--------Would I recommend it?--------

Hard to tell. I mean if you already played Wurm Online

reviewText:
Great concept. Being able to play the Wurm Online I know and love truly at my own pace is great. You control the world completely, it has mod support, the devs really care about your opinion and are always adding stuff to both games. Servers are easy to set up and manage, with a little research you can create your own mods for the game too!
The only setback I've seen so far is that you have to be connected to the internet to play it, but that's a steam thing.
I would definitely recommend this to any Wurm Online player who can't afford to keep up a sub/doesn't have the time to get on every day to manage crops/animals/etc. This game lets you go at your own pace without the worry of losing your things.
If you want a sandbox with realistic terraforming, lots of skills to level, animals to tame/fight, then I highly suggest checking this out! If you aren't sure you'll like it, try out the MMO version for free- Wurm Online. :)
Personally I have yet to find a better sandbox than wurm.

reviewText: If you are looking for something a bit more realistic than yout typical survival building game, here it is. so many tiny details that just make sense are slipped in, and the crafting is a bit more in depth than in games like minecraft or terraria . keep in mind though, this causes them to sacrifice graphics. they look pretty dated, but the game play makes up for it. its also pretty slow pased, so i would not recommend going at it alone unless you have a whole lot of time on your hands. if you still arnt sure if you want to get the game, look into playing Wurm Online, witch is FTP for a while, but still pretty pay to win. you also have to play this while connected to the internet, and setup for your own server is pretty complicated when it seems like it should be simple.

reviewText:
In general I don't play games. Unfortunately I'm competely enslaved by Wurm Online - and now I could not resist to give a try to Wurm Unlimited as well.
Wurm will not fit those who will want to finish a game in days and want fast success. Patience, hard work, obstacles and obstacles all the time - if you are the bulldog-type you will love to still be able to finish your plans.
Will you ever feel Unlimited is too easy, give a try to Wurm Online too :D
Does this game look to have a simpler interface than others? No quests, nobody is holdnig your hands on what to do and when to do?
Try to wander around, the scenery is beautiful, as a beginning go and see the mountains in a dawn fog.
...and don't forget - this world you can really form to your needs: each and every tile of the land is changeable, and you can build wall by wall, not just predesigned complete structures.

reviewText:
If you like minecraft with extensive details and elderscrolls like graphics this will be the game for you! With amazing detail and an insane amount of skills there is always something for you to do!

From killing large rats, to killing a dragon, or even an avatar of a god, to chopping your first tree down, to making your first castle, this is a game your gonna love. Play on your own server or play online with 100s of people in game servers with amazing communitys!

I highly recommend this game to anyone. Its thrives around players who like getting deep in creative games. It appeals to fantasy audience and sandbox audience. Its very noob friendly, and veteran friendly.

Pros:
In depth
Constant new content
tons of skills
Customization to the world
Online servers
DRAGONS.. nuff said
Buildings
Transportation(creatures and vehicles)
Great player community

Cons:
You dont have it yet

reviewText:
I have played wurm for 3 years been part of all sorta sides on the pvp start of the game. been on Mol rehan, Black light, Jen kellon and I know most of the game mechians. I noticed that Wurm unlimited was much more stable than Wurm online.

So both version of the game is the same Except on wurm online you pay to play and on Wurm Unlimited you simply just pay one time and you can play forever til the world ends. or well til the internet dies.

But do I recommand this game? Yeah if you dont want to pay each month for a character and a towm (town isn't needed but it's for safety and having a chance to hide behind walls and have your own real life slaves who work for you if you command them to do stuff.)  If you think wurm online community is to harsh then this version WILL please you.

I saw noobies talking about ropemaking and how amesome it was and that their the best... with a simple 15 in skill... Oh the time for each action was set to 7X speed and Skill gain was 3X gain. It took me half a hour to get my archery to 50 on that server.

I still play wurm online to this very day and Pretty soon we are gonna get rifts, while WU wont get it at all. Well it's a interesting game if you play with your friends.

reviewText:
Awesome game from the team that wrote Minecraft.
Could be different if Notch (Minecraft author) would stay longer.

I played this game on official servers for nearly 3 years, on and off, due to grinding.
Getting harder due higher skill gives you less gain and to master professio, takes time.
Nowadays, game is made easier, less drop down menus, more craftin in the crafter window.
You can set skill gain ratio, so faster skill gain.
Imagine building large sail ships in old days, with 30k elements :)

Freedom. You can build, do, create, craft, whatever you want, within the mechanics.

This game, like MC, is truly a sandbox game, with great community.
I myself had few ideas that made the game more enjoyable :) like finding cotton, not seeds :p

Enjoy :)

reviewText: When I first purchased this game.. I was like what the hell is this... so much ♥♥♥♥ UI ... So ugly... I refunded it.. But then something from the game called me back. So again I ventured in the what I thought was a stale game, Only to relize what a gem this really is. I wondered for about a half an hour and found a fellow traveler working twoards the same goal as me... Which was to get across this river. We both walked  on the side of the cliff *BTW DON'T do THIS* Reason being walking on cliff consumes alot of stamina. Very close to death we made it to flat land. Only to come across a bear who killed my fellow traveler. I got his name but did not see him again... And in the end  I made it the other side because of his sacrifice. That moment instilled a sorta of feeling in me that I can't really describe.This moment combined with the music and the cheesy but loveable visuals is when this game began to work it's way into my heart. The crafting in this game is kinda crazy grindy but very rewarding. You can build anything from a full keep to a humble farm. .. Take a some time before giving this game to the dogs.

reviewText:
Do not pay for this game.

The server that runs in the background has serious memory leaks and writes constantly to the servers drives rather than using the standard practice of batch writes.  Running this on any server is going to be a huge resource hog.  If you thought you would run this on a local machine and connect locally you will wear out your machine very quickly.  I am sorely upset that it took me over the two hours playtime to discover these issues and so cannot get a refund from steam.

This server cannot run in offline mode and the client is useless unless there is an internet connection as a result.  Even on a local lan the server requires authentication through steam.

Steams refund policy for server based products needs to be examined.  2 hours is not enough time to examine a server based product.  You have to run a server for 10-12 hours to get matrix on performance.

At any rate there are so many pitfalls in this offering that its wasted money.  Very disappoited.

reviewText: Well.....  what can I say.... 20 minutes ago I was seriously considering getting a refund.  I *want* to play it.  I LOVE complicated games.  In fact, my favorite game of all time is my heavily modded Minecraft.  I thought for sure Wurm Unlimited would be perfect to get my hands dirty and have some complex fun, but wrestling with the server set up has been an annoying pain (I've run dozens of Minecraft servers without a hitch), and since you have to run a server even for single player....  well...  I'm glad I finally got it working, but frankly, the time I had to play it for today is done, and all I did was wrestle with getting the server set up.  Devs, this isn't fun.  :/  Now that I know how to get the server working every time for myself, (I'll worry about setting one up for friends AND myself another day), I'm gonna hold onto the game and hope, desperately, that the devs do a bit of work on some of these start up issues.  As it stands right now, I think the game needs a little bit more fixing up to be new player" ready.   I can't comment about the actual game play itself as
date: after all this "play time" I STILL haven't actually played any of it
recommended: but after the time I've spent trying to get it going
hoursPlayed: I'm gonna call it a Not Recommended.  At least at the moment.  I may change my mind later."

But certainly recommended for people who look for a deep game experience.

reviewText: This game is a copy of Life is Feudal: Your Own. Not to say that is a bad thing, because this version may have lower graphical requirements (lower quality) then LiF does, it can also run on not only more computers but it also is much more expanded then Lif currently is.\nOnce you get the key bindings the way you like them it doesn't take long to figure out the crafting system. It is literally step by step to do everything, but at least it shows you which steps to take and tells you what you need in order to complete it. So even tho it looks at 1st like it is confusing, read carefully and pay attention and it is not hard at all.\nThe game also offers the option to host your own private server for yourself and/or friends only and every possible adjustment to the settings in game you could ever need. Multipliers on skills, grow periods, breeding times etc. The list goes on and on. I have not yet tried to play the game with friends but it is something we are considering trying at some point.

reviewText:
First Impression:  I really want to like this game, I really do.  It has a lot of the things I really enjoy like exploring, crafting, trading etc. However if you're the independent type like me and want to do it yourself with as little help as possible then this game probably isn't for you. So after 12 hours of play, I've had it.

As a newb, you start with a variety of things you need to make your way in the world, e.g. a carving knife, tent,  rope,shovel, pick axe, saw etc. The crafting system is fantastic. Everything works well until you try to take on your first animal/monster that has more strength than a rooster, a dog for instance.  Your death is all but guaranteed which results in everything you collected and made dropping on the ground and availble to anyone who decides they want it.  Ok not so bad, just don't pick on things above the level of a rooster like dogs, or sheep, or cows or seals etc.  Leave them alone and they leave you alone.

Unfortunately many critters are aggressive, and appear virutally everywhere in the game, wolves for instance. As a newb even these lower level critters are impossible to defeat.  This has the effect of restricting your ability to build things because if you die in the wilderness you spawn someplace else and likely far away. And good luck trying to find your corpse to recover your stuff inasmuch as there is no way of identifying where you were other than guesstimating using the game map.

With a better combat system and more low level stuff to kill that would allow you to level you combat skills faster this game would be almost perfect. Unfortunately killing roosters, WHEN you can find them, gets old fast.

reviewText:
Before buying or playing this game, consider stabbing yourself in the eye first. At least you'll die quickly.

In a phrase: This game is a HORRIFIC version of Minecraft. Imagine if, in Minecraft, in order to chop down trees you had to increase a skill called Woodcutting. And increasing that skill would take you several HUNDRED hours of grinding, to get it to a reasonable level of tree-chopping-intensity. Now multiply that for everything in the game. Dirt? Digging. Stone? Mining. Planting crops? Farming. Fighting. Blacksmithing. Yo-yoing. Yes, you're going to spend more time grinding one skill in this game than it took you to finish Final Fantasy 7, unlock all the final limit breaks, get a gold chocobo, kill Emerald and Ruby weapon, and get the Knights Of The Round summon.

The graphics are horrible. Constant screen clipping, no third person mode, static animations, and characters that attempt to appear lifelike but are actually more static than the blocky characters in Minecraft. Little character customization means you can either spend 10,000 hours of your life to make your character look different (not exaggerating), or you can look like everyone else. So everyone looks the same.

The monsters are uninteresting and they all behave the same. Cat, Dog, Rat, Scorpion, Bear, Spider --- I just named half of the monsters available in the game. They are all the same thing - a static animal with minor animation and a hit box.

The sounds are terrible. Opening a treasure chest sounds like an overweight neckbeard full of cheese just farted inside your hoodie. You can actually fart on other characters -- which normally would be funny and awesome, but this game somehow takes what should be a universally funny thing and makes it actually bad. All of the characters can emote to each other and the emotes are FAR louder than any of the other sounds in the game, and are actually rather scary when you hear them for the first time.

The combat system is horrific. The game starts you out with a sword and shield, but you really won't even be able to kill a SINGLE rat without getting completely wrecked. If you do manage to die, then congradulations, you've just lost 20 or more hours of the skill grinding that you completed to get to where you are now. Yes: When you die, you actually LOSE SKILLS that you gain, AND all of the items you were carrying. The death penalty in this game is so harsh that I'd rather die in Hardcore mode in Diablo 3 and lose my character forever than die in this game -- making a new character in Diablo 3 would actually take less time to gear up than trying to regain the skill loss in Wurm.

The main attraction of this game is that you can claim land a deed" and make it your own

reviewText:
This game is SUPER COMPLICATED.
Firstly, this game needs a really good computer to run, otherwise expect lag. Honestly, I don't even have that bad of a system to run it.
MOST IMPORTANTLY, this game takes a lot of time to get use to. Everything about it seems rather slow. Combat is slow, progress is slow, traveling is extremely slow, and a lot of death. There just so many that make you realize how slow this game is, and you will notice is right from the get go. I think this game uses this concept of being slow to make it seems like it's a really impersive game. However, I don't think that's what makes it imersive, I think it's the content. I didn't play enough to really experience all the contect. I tried creating my own server to try and accelorate everything, but it still took for ever. Honestly, be ready to LIVE in this game if you want to accomplish anything, and I really mean anything like building a structure - GOOD LUCK!
I am not trying to bash this game, but it was not for me. I would not reccomand this to my friends because I still want my friends to participate in real life, this game will prohibit that. Also, I know I said it's complicated, I don't mean that it's difficult to understand, I think it's just too time consuming to understand. It's like learning a language.

reviewText:
Original review:

I would love to have had a real opportunity to try this game out. I believe that it would have been a really great game. Sadly I have had to refund it. I created a character on a few different public servers and their bodies were always stretched out and their heads moved a foot infront of their necks. This pretty much made it unplayable due to not being able to see much of anything.

On top of that I was unable to create a LAN server that I could see on the server list. I followed all of the guides and it simply didn't work out for me.

If the streaching man problem would have not occured, I may have been able to deal with not being able to have my own server, but that pushed it over the top.

If there was a simpler way to have a single player experience, and if the streatching man issues was resolved, I would definantly give this game another shot. Until then, I will not be able to recommend this.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

edit: Since posting this review I have figured out how to fix the Stretching man issue. I have also been able to play Wurm Online. From what I understand it is exactly like Wurm Unlimited in terms of gameplay. I really love the gameplay in this. And if I was only looking at the gameplay with this review, then I would be recommending it to everyone. However, singleplayer is a key aspect in Wurm Unlimited, and I was never able to get it to work despite following all of the guides. Because of this I am going to have to downvote it for now.

I hope this helps!

reviewText:
REFUND REQUESTED
Purchased this game as it offered a single player experience. However I didn’t realise at the time you HAD to host your own server. But OK I’ll set up my own. Follow the instructions in the community guide. Server won’t show up anywhere. Try it again x5. Still no server. Look through various discussions, try different things suggested there. Still no server. See a patch has come out the next day. Try again still no luck. Wait some more time. Fiddle with Firewall/antivirus settings. Still no server anywhere to be found. Give up, request refund. I wanted to play the game solo.

The ONLY way to do this is by hosting your own server. I can’t do this so basically I can’t play solo at all. Game may be fantastic, but unless I want to play with others I’ll never know. A few people seem to be having problems with the game but there seems to be very little support from the Devs, not a good sign as the game has only been out just over a week at time of writing.

reviewText:
This game has some potential. I did not play it PvP or with others and I think if there's any real fun to be had with this game it would be with that.

The primary problem I had with this game is a lack of NPCs. It has as amazing crafting system, but to build a lot of things you have to be a jack of all trades mining, smithing, sewing, cooking, and so forth. For example, you can be a great wood worker, but that doesn't help you make metal arrow heads which are required to make arrows. There probably should have been some more primitive options like flint arrow heads or something.

Anyway, you would think you would go to a town and trade for the items you are not prepared to make yourself. But when I finally found my way to Hearth (a city in the game), There was only one NPC that would talk to me who was obviously there to guide new players on what to do (although by the time I found him I had been playing for an entire day already and knew how to do pretty much everything he taught). He eventually directed me to an NPC that did nothing but stand there who was, I suspect, probably the guy you are supposed to trade with. Basically, there was nothing in the city to interact with which largely made the city pointless.

And that really gets to the point of Why are you crafting all this stuff?" I suppose there's something sort of "Mine Craft" about this game. But we've had an over abundance of "You're alone in the world - go build some stuff" games.

This is really the MMORPG handed over to you. You have to setup your own server to play alone.

But this also means that if you had a group of friends
date: you could maybe all play on your server and each could take on different roles as you work together to build a city and such. That might make up for the lack of NPCs.\n\nSome people seem to like it for PvP
recommended: although I personally don't think a crafting game is ideal for PvP. I personally don't think you should have skills and levels for PvP as everyone should basically be on the same level and it should more rely on the player than how much grinding they've done. A level 20 is always going to beat a level 3
hoursPlayed: so what's the point? Get everyone on the same level and then it becomes about the players rather than their characters. But some people are enjoying it for PvP; so more power to them.\n\nOverall
voteText: I felt it was mostly a waste of money. There was a lot to like about the crafting system and survival system
helpfulPercent: but overall I just didn't feel like it delivered."

reviewText:
I'll keep being polite: There must be somewhere a kind of learning curve I missed.

The game is ugly (but I don't really care). The NPCs are frozen and dead like in the 90s. I don't believe running is possible. I kept fleeing monsters and guards by walking. I've succeeded in killing a rooster by accident after fully five minutes of sword slashing (my most epic moment ever).

Then, an army of ghosts attacked me. And killed me (of course). Then, I did kidnling by right-clicking everywhere. That was awesome. Because I was talking all the time with my friend. And then we realized I started a campfire. And it was awesome.

I'm sure there must be people somewhere in the universe for whom this game was made.

Ok, I'm not sure.

Is there a way to have a refund, please?

I want to die.

Oh, I died, again.

Killed by an army of guards that pursued me easily despite them wearing heavy armor and I being mostly nude. And both of us being deep in the water. Best physics ever.

The good part: The game tells you you will die a lot.

It is true.

And it is always awesome.

I'm crying.

reviewText:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME: if you are looking for anything like mincecraft/seven days to die/ark etc. This is not an 'offline game'. It is not offline as it still requires you to faff about making servers etc before you can play. and it is not a game more a very complex simulation with frustratingly unusual basic controls!

I play a lot of games and tried to give this a chance. But no, this game is not good.

I appreciate it is meant to be a simulation and you need to put time in before you get a good character/base etc, but it is the first game I have played (I have 170+ steam games) where there is no help or clue as to how the interface and basic game works.

Also, why change what works? The controls are not the same as 90% of first person games, there is no need for this! I spent five minutes standing being attacked by a wolf whilst not attacking it back despite trying everything to work out how...


This was after spending two hours between google, steam help and the game trying to work out how to get it running! what is wrong with the good old start game -> choose new game or load game from a normal menu -> play the game.

It was not made clear on teh game information from the store page that this 'offline' version of the game still requires a working knowledge of server creation and such like.

reviewText:
I'm not sure why this has any sort of positive review at all.  This game is one of two I have ever requested a refund for.  There is nothing here to recommend, because plainly & simply the description lies.

Let me be clear:  this is NOT a single player game.  You can only play as a single player if you create a server for yourself, lock it and then enter it.  I'm not sure why that qualifies as a signle player game, but it definitely wasn't what I was looking for.

Other than that, the graphics are ancient, the controls clunky and hard to understand, and there is no tutorial.

I have no idea if any of the other claims of the game are accurate - I couldn't play for more than a few minutes before burning this bridge, never to return.

reviewText:
Definately not a game you want to pick up casually if you've never played the MMO. Its my honest reccomendation if your considering this game, to do some research. Definately watch some videos of gameplay other than the ones listed on Steam.

There's a real steep learning curve for this game that's pretty frustrating if your not playing on a server, or the MMO. You don't have the opportunity to ask 'Noob' questions via chat like more experienced players have been able to before.

There's also not a wiki support for the game like will find with other sandbox games (like Minecraft) that detail how to craft items, or what the prerequisite to obtaining the are. As others have commented below, it is possible to find the information you need to get started; but you'd better be ready to spend a heafty amount of time watching Youtube Videos, and browsing forums before you'll be able to actually play the game.

For example: the developers do a poor job of setting expectations for how long it will take to build your empire. In the video, building  speed is obviously sped up - but  if your expecting to get even a wall built within your first 5 hours of gameplay you're in for a surprise. To build a wall requires wood, and nails. Wood is pretty easy to obtain. Chop down a tree, cord it up, and then saw up some boards. However, to get the nails is an entirely different story...

To tunnlel out a mine takes 'actions' and the default action for mining is roughly 9~ seconds. It takes between 30 to 50 'actions' to move one block in. That's Roughtly 4 ~7 minutes to mine ONE 'block' in. Now imagine you have to find the iron 5 blocks deep that it takes to make the nails, to build your first wall.

I'm not saying this game doesn't have the potential to be fun, but if you're looking for a sandbox you can pick up and run with in an afternoon, I'd suggest watching some Lets Play videos first to get your feet wet.

reviewText:
I cannot recommend this game and here is why.

You character is basically a snail - you move so slow.
You can't swim very far or you'll drown.
When prospecting for Iron, good luck climbing the hills and not falling over and over.
Once you get spot picked out, where is says there is Iron - good luck finding it. From the outside it says it near by but once you are in you mine suddenly it's not near by anymore. you Dig up and down and all around and 2 hours later after several tunnels - still no iron one. So you start a new server to start over hoping for rock lower down... 3 hours into it, no iron.
You're are overloaded too quickly and then the snail pace turns into not moving at all. So you start dropping things everywhere all the time.
Good luck leveling the dirt too. You can only hold so much in your inventory so moving it around it a massive time sink but it doesn't matter. After 14 hours of mining and chopping and basically understanding what the life of a snail is like because you pretty much accomplish nothing...
Oh and then there is the combat... again it's like a couple of snails going at it. You can watch a movie while you play this game.
IF the game allowed the player to move twice the speed - it wouldn't be so bad.
IF finding an iron ore vein wasn't a massive time sink - it wouldn't be so bad.
IF you could swim - it wouldn't be so bad.
IF you didn't have to spend hours and hours mining - it wouldn't be so bad.

This game should be selling for $5 with a warning. All these people giving it good reviews are really not being truthful. You move so slow everywhere... slow... slow... slow...

so buy it, try it and you'll see.
It's not for everyone - I can see why this was ditched for Minecraft(which is a great success).

I've never written a negative review and I feel a little bad. ut I played 14 hours and spent about 10 hours on you tube watching others play, trying to figure out what I was doing wrong and I figured it out. I was playing...

reviewText:
I just bought Wurm and i've only put about 5 hours into it, and I gotta say, i'm not impressed.

It was like playing a game from 1998, and not in a wow this is so classic" kind of way.

-The user interface is a painfully illdesigned and antiquated one where you have to interract with several windows clicking and dragging things just to get the most basic things done. The gaming world has evolved past this sort of idea to a much more friendly hotkey/drag-and-drop system.

-Just trying to chop a tree down involves having to open the inventory (which is list based)
hoursPlayed: then drag the currently equipped sword into your inventory
voteText: then drag the axe into your right hand
helpfulPercent: then right click on the tree
votesHelpful: then slect a series of options on the popup menu
votesTotal: then repeat until the tree falls down.\n\nIt's just bulky and combersome
votesFunny: and for no reason.\n\n-The actual play is slow
column16: moving around the world is slow
column17: the reaction to items you have to interface with is slow
column18:
and the general gameplay is slow.

I will NOT be recommending this game to any of my friends.

I just wish I could get my money back."

reviewText:
Do you like standing around, clicking on things and waiting hours to get basic materials?
Do you like spending 1000's of hours of leveling up your skills, just so that you can successfully put a block of wood ontop of a stick, and then a further 10,000 hours just to make your first shed?
Well this is the game for you!
The only redeaming feature I could find was the 'emotes' option.
If you have a heck of a lot of free time, and find menu's and percentages really interesting then this might be good? After a few in real life months you might have so relative success.
But anyone looking for a fun, interesting fast-paced crafting survival game to play with friends, which consatnatly offers new advancements and challenges, should steer clear from this game. Managed to get a lot more enjoyment out of games such as Reign of Kings.

reviewText:
Looks horrible.  Seriously, it being a mmo being played today that looks like this makes me wonder who actually played this game. Blind people?

The interface is the absolute worst I have encountered ever.  I can't believe this was the best interface they could come up with.  You would have to work really hard to choose all the worst methods to do things to arrive at this system.

The private servers function that differentiates this from the mmo doesn't work well.  I could get it to actually launch 2 times out of 14.

In game quests are glitchy as the required options are not present with npc's so could not advance in the tutorial.

Overall, extremely underwhelmed and refunded this purchase.  If the developer could fix the issues that make this not work, maybe it would be worth picking up again, but from the forums it doesn't seem like the people with experience with this developer expect much support for this title.

reviewText: I do recommend this game, but with reservation. The download and install can be a tricky and hard to figure out. Once that is done, the game itself is very arcane and complicated. It is not as intuitive as I would have wanted it to be. You will def. need to alt+tab to google wurm unlimited" for all of your answers. Do not bother with the in-help game pedia as it is woefully lacking and pointless. There are some glaring glitches and there are MANY CTDs. This is the most unfortunate aspect of the game: it will simply just lock up and it takes FOREVER to close. By forever I mean go pack your lunch for work
recommended: and shower and it MIGHT be close to closing and going to desktop. I ended up just doing a hard restart which was 100% quicker
hoursPlayed: but I know is hard on the system. I have scoured the internet for answers to the ctds but there is really no help beyond the idiotic "check your drivers" "restart your computer" etc. etc. You know
voteText: the things that NEVER help but every incompetent fool tells you because they don't know what else to say...\n\nThe game is worth buying and playing though despite all the horse manure that comes close to ruining the experience. There are subtle "ah ha" moments that really endear the game. I cannot stress enough to go online for all your questions because you can easily get too frustrated and just quit. The "wurmpedia" is a terrific resource and without it the game would be pointlessly too hard. Last
helpfulPercent: I HIGHLY recommend setting up your own server and getting to know the game first before going head to head with other players. Also
votesHelpful: when you are setting up your own game: don't be afraid to give yourself a very high starting value for all of your attributes and skills. The game is hard enough and you will not feel like you are cheating whatsoever. I didn't do this and it took a very long time to become even average in my skill levels. Even then I still have animals kill me that should never be able to. Also
votesTotal: raise the quality of your weapons as soon as possible (this is called "improve"). You may think just because you have mined
votesFunny: smelted
commentsCount: and forged your longsword after a week straight of hour upon hour grinding that you can now go take on that wolf or bear only to be killed even faster than when using your starting shortsword! It is because you still need to raise the quality of the weapon... I just saved you a LOT of frustration and hours of research. :-) This game is serious and not for quick thrill gamers. It is for the patient

reviewText:
What can I say about Wurm Unlimited, now that I'm no longer having crash issues?

It's Wurm Online, but it's cheaper

If you've played Wurm online, and liked it, You will enjoy Wurm Unlimited just as well, if not more.

Newcomers to the game beware, you are in for one hell of a ride, because this game, is certainly not for everyone.

You will have to fight the UI, The Graphics might remind of you Everquest, and the labor system will have you sobbing at first.

But soon, you'll learn to love it. I promise.

reviewText:
I don't doubt the depth of this game once you fully understand it's inner workings, however, I cannot get past it's complexity.  Absolutely nothing is straight forward and extremely time consuming.  Even digging a damn hole, try to dig straight into the side of a hill and you will only dig straight down and then uh oh, you can't dig on that type of terrain.  It's difficult to level an area to start building.  I tried to use the in game guide but most descriptions are remarkably long and vague.  I tried to watch Youtube videos but they too are incredibly long and hard to understand because key points are mixed in with 10 to 15 minutes of rambling.  Man, I already gave my best years to Uncle Sam, I don't need to spend the last half of my life figuring out the basic machanics of a video game.  I would only recommend this game to someone with absolutely no life and patience that is insurmountable.

*Update*

Due to my stubborness and the money I spent on this game, I have persisted in trying to open this game up to see if it got better with a little more understanding.  I have found it is in fact a very deep and amazing game along the lines of Minecraft (I say that loosely due to the fact that it is much more in depth than Minecraft).  As you can see, I have sunk 90+ hours into this game, 70 of which was with my wife who also bought the game to give it a try.  About 15 of those hours was dedicated to leveling a 12x13 patch of land between a bay and a small lake to build a castle and courtyard.  While I know it is a big job to build such an abode, we find that it is entirely too time consuming.  90% of the time you are waiting for action bars ~2-5 seconds each, but we are talking thousands of times.  To level the land we have scalped and gutted a hill behind where the castle sits for the dirt and stone with the intentions of leveling the hill itself when finished.  This hill is almost completely gutted now, and I have found absolutely no information either on forums, wurmpedia or youtube on how to actually demolish the carcass of it.  It wont let us mine the outer walls, so now we are left with the eyesore blocking our view to the bay.  With all that work and all those hours and all that material, we have only finished the shell of the first floor and half of the second.
Now, having said all that, this is my point.  I play video games a lot.  I almost eat, sleep and breath them.  It blows me away that it is such a large game that has been around for about ten years and it still has actions, items and other good to know things that either has no description or explanation that is plainly worded and easy to understand.  Or if there is it is so hard to find.  It took me several attempts to find an explanation on how to expose a rock face to make a tunnel I don't have to climb to (you have to dig all four corners of a tile until you hit rock).  Why was something so simple yet so necessary wrapped up in a 20 minute video on youtube instead of being the first thing stated on the ingame wiki?  Why is there no back button on the crafting guide menu?   I stand by my initial review.  This game is definitely for people who love Minecraft but want better asthetical creations and not only have the time to devote to the creation but also the patience.  Either that or many, many friends that will play as well to help with the man hours needed to complete projects.On the server list you'll see tons of servers, but most are empty and locked or they have 1 to 2 players on it.  That is the player base and it is remarkably small.

Update, Mar 2, 2016:

I admit, my initial opinion of this game was a little harsh.  190hrs+ in the game and I still have much I don't know in regards to certain aspects of the game, such as religion, magic, etc.  That being said  I have changed my mind about the monotony of the game, but it comes at a serious learning curve.  Navigation in the world sucks in my opinion.  It's easy as hell to get lost if you dare to explore, especially in dense forests.  It does have a remarkably indescript map and it leaves you wondering which hill you are standing on or which channel of the sea you are looking at since you don't have a character marker on the map.  As of the latest patch farms are now useless because crops timers aren't working so they will only grow with GM powers.  Here's hoping they hotfix it soon.    Aside from navigation and the complexity (including server management) the game is pretty good.  Incredibly in depth, and like I said before, minecraft for adults.

reviewText:
Nice game, very optimized and running absolutely fine on linux, same thing for the server, you can host a server on a small 3 euros 2go virtual private server and have no problem at all, this is not the case of some other games such as minecraft that are ressource-heavy!

This game is quite addictive and therefore needs quite a lot of time to be played even if you tweak the settings, but if you tweak them too much you will feel like you cheated, so I would advise buying the game only if you have enough free time or are on holiday. I would also recommend playing with at least one friend to make things faster.

So buy this game if you feel you have enough free time, are a minecraft survival fan and like beeing able to do whatever you want in a game (as opposed to playing stupid linear games), it's definitely worth buying it !

reviewText: Wurm the MORPG is one of the greatest games of all time.  The crafting is emaculate.  This is the college graduate program of mine-crafty types and the highmark standard for authentic play.  The feeling of building a small settlement with friends, getting bigger,  bringing in more workers, having a spy, getting invaded and having our new castle razed to the bottom of the mine was life changing.  Do you want to know the true struggle of a medievil mason?  How about the real honor and valour it takes to me a knight?  This is like living in a documentary.  Be prepared for the slow grind, but also be thrilled that you can now changed EVERYTHING about the game in Unlimited.  Wurm is truly worth your time.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I really like this game and recommend it.

It's a fun and relaxing crafting game for those who do not need instant gratification. I'm a single player type of gamer. This is the first time I've got involved with an online game world and am really enjoying it.

It will take some time to learn the ins and outs. There are many youtube videos that can help you get started. There's also an in-game help guide while crafting that is invaluable. And I've found that people in the servers are more than happy to help answer questions. Everyone I've met on the  servers have been very friendly and helpful.

Once you figure out how to create in the world, the skies the limit. You can find your own slice of the game world and build your own mini-empire.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Very cool game. On their forums there's even a map maker for you own continents. Lots of settings so I could make my own adjustments to skill gain and mobs and lots of other things. If I don't want to grind I don't have to. Back to the game.

Okay, now the developer has gone back on what he said was going to happen. Originally the dev of the online version was to be done and then that dev added to Unlimited. That's why many bought the game, both versions had been promised to be the same.

Well now he says oh never mind, I'm going to develope content for online that you Unlimited folks will NEVER see unless you also pay for my online version. Nice right?

So even though this is a nice game you have a developer you can't trust. Don't buy it.

reviewText: I just started playing Wurm unlimited.  No idea what i was getting into.. For the price i did get other games where you craft and survive for cheaper ( 7 days to die, rust empyrion galactic...).  I bought it and decided to give it a fair shot!  Honnestly it is a great game!  Ok i admit coming in going wait a minute this aint wow no question mark telling me where the quest giver is.  Old school kicking in.  I can forage. I can build a fire but i need to chop wood make kiddling use flint and steel. etc..etc.. Omg this is so realistic and fun.  I actuly need to find food and water to survive not just use to buff.  I tried all mmorpg out there. I tried all kinds of survival sandbox game.. I love crafting, exploring questing.  This game is a Gem!  You really do it all!  Understand there is no class you do what you want raise the skills that you want.   Live the online game that you want.
